name: Converting a binary string (base2) to denary (base10)
description:
Complete the function `bin2den()` which takes an argument consisting of a string of numbers in the format of either a nibble or a byte and converts the string to a denary (base 10) number.

The program must discern whether the number is 4 bits (a nibble) or 8 bits (a byte).
If the string is not either 4 or 8 characters in length, the program must return a string thats states that there is an `"Incorrect length"` in the binary number. If the string contains characters other than 1 or 0, the program should return `"Invalid binary sequence"`.

## Examples

- "0101"      --> 5
- "10000001"  --> 129
- "11110"     --> "Incorrect length"
- "1234"      --> "Invalid binary sequence"
